medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pleural effusion was incidentally noted on MRI of the breasts that has been performed for cancer screening. The patient had no current dyspnea, orthopnea, cough, or wheeze but experienced intermittent mild dyspnea and a rapid heart rate after eating.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of excisional biopsies of the breasts for fibroadenoma at 20 years of age and fibrocystic changes at 33 years of age. Medical history includes previous exploratory laparotomy, rectus diastasis repair, and a right ovarian cystectomy. Conditions included cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, oral herpes simplex virus, supraventricular tachycardia, mild gastroesophageal reflux, and quiescent muscle fasciculations and paresthesia.
medical_history.family_history: Strong family history of breast cancer: mother with bilateral lobular breast carcinoma and maternal grandmother with breast cancer. Other notable family history includes father's prostate cancer, paternal cousin's lymphoma, and a history of various cancers among other relatives.
medical_history.social_history: Lifelong nonsmoker, never used illicit drugs, rare alcohol consumption, employed as a physician-scientist, lives with husband and three healthy daughters. Previously worked on a family farm, owns two dogs, and had travel history to Africa and China.
